mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Robert E. (Robert Edward), 1807-1870
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lee and likely his faculty react to a pending gathering and procession of Washington College students in the streets of Lexington. Lee expounds on the lack of benefit of such events for the the town, the students, and the reputation of the college. He asks that such events cease.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington College (Lexington, Va.) -- Students
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from R. E. Lee to Washington College Student Body, March 30, 1869 (correspondence)
